description: Patterns for market analysis including competitive pressure, market trends, and positioning issues

patterns.name: Competitive Pressure Detection
patterns.description: Detects issues related to competitive threats, market share loss, and competitive positioning challenges

hypotheses.statement: Competitors may have achieved feature parity or superiority, eroding {{primarySubject}}'s competitive advantage
investigationSteps: Conduct comprehensive feature comparison with top 3-5 competitors
Analyze competitor product releases and roadmap announcements
Review win/loss analysis for feature-related losses
Survey customers about competitor feature preferences
Track competitor review sites for feature mentions
expectedFindings: Competitors have matched or exceeded key differentiating features
Recent competitor releases addressing previous gaps
Feature gaps mentioned in lost deal analysis
Customer requests for features competitors already have
Declining feature advantage scores in analyst reports

hypotheses.statement: Competitor pricing strategies may be undercutting {{primarySubject}}'s market position
investigationSteps: Gather competitive pricing intelligence across all tiers
Analyze price-to-value perception in customer surveys
Review lost deals for pricing-related reasons
Compare total cost of ownership with competitors
Assess competitor discounting patterns and promotions
expectedFindings: Competitors offering similar value at lower prices
Aggressive competitor discounting in key segments
Price mentioned as primary reason in lost deals
Customer perception of poor price-to-value ratio
Competitor promotional campaigns affecting win rates

hypotheses.statement: {{primarySubject}} may be falling behind competitors in innovation and product development velocity
investigationSteps: Compare product release frequency with competitors
Analyze time-to-market for new features vs competitors
Review industry analyst reports on innovation leadership
Track patent filings and R&D investments of competitors
Assess customer perception of innovation leadership
expectedFindings: Competitors releasing features faster
Longer development cycles compared to industry
Declining innovation scores in analyst reports
Competitors leading in emerging technology adoption
Customer perception of product stagnation

hypotheses.statement: {{primarySubject}}'s value proposition may no longer resonate with target market needs
investigationSteps: Review value proposition messaging effectiveness
Analyze customer feedback on perceived value
Compare value messaging with competitor positioning
Assess alignment between value proposition and customer priorities
Test value proposition with target audience
expectedFindings: Value proposition not addressing current customer priorities
Competitor messaging resonating better with market
Disconnect between stated value and customer perception
Outdated value proposition not reflecting product evolution
Low recall of key differentiators among prospects

recommendations.action: Establish systematic competitive intelligence program to monitor {{primarySubject}}'s competitive landscape
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Real-time visibility into competitor moves and market dynamics

recommendations.action: Implement structured win/loss analysis program to understand competitive dynamics
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Quantified understanding of why deals are won or lost to competitors

recommendations.action: Develop and execute differentiation strategy to strengthen competitive position
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear, defensible competitive differentiation in target segments

recommendations.action: Optimize pricing strategy based on competitive positioning and value delivery
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Competitive pricing that reflects value and market position

recommendations.action: Create and maintain competitive battle cards for sales enablement
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Sales team equipped to effectively compete against key competitors

recommendations.action: Accelerate product innovation to regain competitive advantage
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Faster time-to-market and restored innovation leadership

patterns.name: Market Trend Detection
patterns.description: Detects issues related to market trends, industry shifts, and changing market dynamics

hypotheses.statement: Emerging technologies may be disrupting {{primarySubject}}'s market and creating new competitive dynamics
investigationSteps: Identify emerging technologies affecting the industry
Analyze technology adoption curves and timing
Review analyst reports on technology disruption
Assess competitor technology investments and strategies
Evaluate impact on customer needs and expectations
expectedFindings: New technologies enabling alternative solutions
Startups leveraging new tech to enter market
Customer expectations shifting due to technology
Traditional approaches becoming obsolete
Technology-driven business model changes

hypotheses.statement: Customer buying behavior and preferences may be shifting in ways that affect {{primarySubject}}'s market position
investigationSteps: Analyze customer behavior data and trends
Review industry research on buyer preferences
Survey customers about changing needs and priorities
Track customer journey changes over time
Assess generational differences in buying behavior
expectedFindings: Shift in purchase decision criteria
New buying channels gaining preference
Changed expectations for product/service delivery
Different value priorities among customer segments
Generational shifts affecting market dynamics

hypotheses.statement: Market segments may be evolving with some growing and others declining, affecting {{primarySubject}}'s addressable market
investigationSteps: Analyze market segment size and growth rates
Review industry reports on segment dynamics
Track customer migration between segments
Assess new segment emergence and characteristics
Evaluate segment profitability trends
expectedFindings: Core segments declining or commoditizing
New high-growth segments emerging
Customer migration to different segments
Segment boundaries blurring or shifting
Profitability changes across segments

hypotheses.statement: Industry business models may be evolving in ways that require {{primarySubject}} to adapt
investigationSteps: Analyze business model innovations in the industry
Review competitor business model changes
Assess customer preferences for different models
Evaluate economics of emerging business models
Track investor interest in new business models
expectedFindings: Subscription models replacing one-time purchases
Platform and marketplace models gaining traction
Bundling/unbundling trends affecting value chains
New monetization approaches emerging
Customer preference for different engagement models

recommendations.action: Conduct comprehensive market research to understand current trends affecting {{primarySubject}}
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear understanding of market trends and their implications

recommendations.action: Establish ongoing market trend monitoring and early warning system
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Early identification of emerging trends and market shifts

recommendations.action: Develop scenario plans for different market evolution paths
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Prepared strategies for multiple market scenarios

recommendations.action: Conduct customer research to understand evolving needs and preferences
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Deep understanding of customer evolution and future needs

recommendations.action: Adapt strategy and product roadmap to align with market trends
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Strategy aligned with market direction and opportunities

recommendations.action: Invest in innovation to capitalize on emerging trends and opportunities
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Positioned to lead or fast-follow market evolution

recommendations.action: Explore expansion into growing market segments or adjacent markets
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Diversified market presence and growth opportunities

patterns.name: Market Positioning Issues
patterns.description: Detects issues related to market positioning, brand perception, and differentiation challenges

hypotheses.statement: {{primarySubject}}'s differentiation may be unclear or not compelling to target customers
investigationSteps: Survey customers and prospects about perceived differentiation
Analyze messaging clarity and consistency across channels
Compare positioning with competitor messaging
Review sales conversations for differentiation effectiveness
Test positioning statements with target audience
expectedFindings: Customers unable to articulate key differentiators
Inconsistent messaging across marketing channels
Positioning too similar to competitors
Sales struggling to communicate unique value
Low recall of differentiation in market research

hypotheses.statement: {{primarySubject}} may be targeting the wrong market segments or customer profiles
investigationSteps: Analyze customer success patterns by segment
Review ideal customer profile accuracy
Compare target market with actual customer base
Assess product-market fit across segments
Evaluate segment profitability and growth potential
expectedFindings: Best customers don't match target profile
Low conversion rates in target segments
High churn in targeted customer segments
Product features misaligned with target needs
Untapped segments with better fit

hypotheses.statement: {{primarySubject}}'s messaging may not effectively communicate value to target audience
investigationSteps: Analyze marketing content performance metrics
Review message testing results and A/B tests
Assess message resonance through customer feedback
Compare messaging effectiveness with competitors
Evaluate consistency across customer touchpoints
expectedFindings: Low engagement with marketing content
Poor performance in message testing
Customer feedback indicating confusion
Competitor messaging outperforming in tests
Inconsistent messaging creating confusion

hypotheses.statement: {{primarySubject}}'s value proposition may not align with what target customers actually value
investigationSteps: Research customer priorities and decision criteria
Compare value proposition with customer needs
Analyze win/loss data for value-related factors
Survey customers about value perception
Review competitor value propositions
expectedFindings: Value proposition emphasizing wrong benefits
Customer priorities not reflected in messaging
Deals lost due to value perception issues
Gap between stated value and customer experience
Competitors better aligned with customer values

recommendations.action: Conduct comprehensive positioning audit to assess current market position of {{primarySubject}}
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear understanding of current positioning effectiveness and gaps

recommendations.action: Conduct customer research to understand value drivers and decision criteria
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Deep understanding of what customers value and how they make decisions

recommendations.action: Refine ideal customer profile based on success patterns and market analysis
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Accurate ICP that guides targeting and positioning

recommendations.action: Develop clear positioning strategy with differentiated value proposition
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Clear, differentiated positioning that resonates with target market

recommendations.action: Create comprehensive messaging framework aligned with positioning
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Consistent, compelling messaging across all channels

recommendations.action: Execute brand refresh to align visual identity with positioning
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Brand identity that reinforces positioning and differentiation

recommendations.action: Enable sales team with positioning tools and training
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Sales team effectively communicating positioning and value

recommendations.action: Execute market repositioning campaign to shift market perception
recommendations.expectedOutcome: Improved market perception aligned with desired positioning

testCases.input: We're facing increased competitive pressure and losing market share to competitors
A new competitor threat is emerging and our competitive advantage is eroding
Competitor pricing is undercutting us and we're in a price war
Our win rate is declining and competitive intel shows competitors gaining ground
Market trends are shifting and we need to understand the market dynamics
Industry disruption is happening and the market is changing rapidly
We need to analyze market growth and understand the TAM, SAM, and SOM
Market saturation is a concern and we're seeing market decline in our core segment
We have a market positioning problem and our differentiation is unclear
Brand perception is not aligned with our positioning strategy
Our value proposition is not resonating and we need to refine our unique value proposition
We need to refine our ICP and ideal customer profile to improve targeting
Market trends are shifting and competitive pressure is increasing as competitors adapt faster
We're losing market share because our positioning and differentiation are weak compared to competitors
Market dynamics are changing and our positioning strategy needs to evolve with the market trends
We're facing competitive pressure, market trends are shifting, and our positioning is unclear
